alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 22 at 9:41PM PDT until May 28 at 6:43AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. .Rain and snowmelt will keep the Kettle River running high for the next several days. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Flooding at Beal Park on West Kettle River Road, west of Curlew. `Ol Swimming Hole Park in Curlew will be inundated. Flooding of yards and outbuildings along the river from the Canadian border through Curlew on both sides of the river. Some driveways on Kettle River Road will be flooded. Water will be over Customs Road near Riverview Lane and between milepost 5 and 6. At 19.7 feet, Water begins to impact State Route 21 near Little Goosemus Road at mile post 185. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM PDT Monday the stage was 18.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 PM PDT Monday was 18.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 20.3 feet late Wednesday morning. It will then fall, and is expected to drop below flood stage by Sunday. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.2 feet on 05/22/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 100 PM PDT.
